results.title: Aids to independence
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Vintage Years”.
Outlines how elderly people can be assisted to live independently and the contribution of voluntary agencies in providing meeting places. Lord Morrison of Lambeth, a pioneer of municipal government discusses the role of the community and the program concludes with an extract from an interview with the famous psychoanalyst Professor Carl Jung when he was 85.

results.title: Illness in old age
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Vintage Years”.
The Geriatric Unit of the Cowley Road Hospital, Oxford, emphasise cure rather than just keeping the elderly in an institution. Includes a day hospital for the convalescent. Doctor Lionel Cosin, a pioneer in this field, explains how the hospital carries out its work.

results.title: Preparation for retirement
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Vintage Years”.
A discussion of the problem of retirement by people who have in fact retired successfully and others who have had considerable experience in assisting others to prepare for retirement.

group_works.title: Understanding stresses and strains (TEFC)
group_works.creator_credit: Hamilton Luske, Ken Peterson and Walt Disney Productions

results.title: Understanding stresses and strains (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Hamilton Luske, Ken Peterson and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Upjohn health series”.
Shows what excessive worry can do to mind and body, and suggests that using common sense can minimise the normal stresses and strains of life and keep all sides of the health triangle in balance.

results.title: The World Meteorological Organization
results.creator_credit: Krishna Singh, V.R. Sarma and United Nations. Office of Public Information
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The United Nations: Its Charter and Organization”.
Traces the history of the World meteorological Organization - a Genva based Specialised Agency of the United Nations. Describes the activities and functions of the organization and explains its role as a co-ordinating body in study of weather phenomena.

results.title: The Trusteeship Council and system
results.creator_credit: J.C. Sheers and United Nations. Office of Public Information
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The United Nations: its charter and organization”
Demonstrates the aims, structure and mechanics of the Trusteeship Council by showing the improved standard of living and eventual independence of Somaliland under the administration of Italy.

results.title: The International Telecommunication Union
results.creator_credit: Krishna Singh, Ramakantha Sarma and United Nations. Office of Public Information
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The United Nations: Its Charter and Organization”.
The conquest of time and distance in communications is one of the miracles of the modern age. Records the technological advances and growing co-operation among nations from the early pioneers to the latest spacecommunication satellites. The role of the International Telecommunication Union is emphasised particularly in the developing countries.
